name: Flat line setup 10m
description: Basic setup with BC blue slackline at dorethea dix park. Great for beginners and super easy to set up.

name: Flat line setup 15m - beginner
description: 15m flat webbing anchored between two trees with basic tree protection. Good for first-time setup and walking practice.

name: Lowline 8m - beginner/intermediate
description: 8m slightly tensioned lowline (low to the ground) using tubular webbing. Easier to fall onto grass; suitable for confidence building.

name: Trickline 12m - intermediate
description: 12m trickline with medium tension for bounces and tricks; requires reliable ratchets and slackline-specific webbing. Intermediate setup: practice dynamic moves.

name: Classic 25m - intermediate
description: 25m flat webbing setup at moderate tension. Needs good tree protection and stronger anchors; perfect for longer walks and flow.

name: Longline 50m - advanced
description: 50m longline that requires backup lines, redundant anchors, and pulley/tensioning systems. High tension and significant sag make rigging complex.

name: Highline 20m - advanced
description: 20m highline setup with full safety backup, leashes, and anchors. Requires experience with knotwork, anchors, and belay systemsâ€”advanced safety-critical rigging.

name: Gap line 6m - intermediate
description: 6m gap line between two short trees or platforms; moderate tension and precise anchor placement required for consistent bounce and safety.
